alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Yakutat; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 12 at 9:04AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY RAINS EXPECTED THURSDAY INTO THURSDAY NIGHT... A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS MOVING INTO THE S GULF AND WILL MOVE N ALONG THE COAST THROUGH THURSDAY INTO EARLY FRIDAY. THIS LOW WILL BRING STRONG WINDS AND RAINY CONDITIONS TO THE PANHANDLE. SEE HIGH WIND PRODUCTS FOR MORE DETAILS ON EXPECTED WINDS. AS FOR PRECIPITATION, A GENERAL 1 TO 3 INCHES OF RAINFALL BETWEEN THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND FRIDAY MORNING IS EXPECTED. HIGHEST AMOUNTS LOOK LIKELY ACROSS THE N PANHANDLE. HEAVIEST RAIN RATES BETWEEN 0.20-0.30 INCHES PER HOUR ARE POSSIBLE ALONG THE OUTER COAST. ADDITIONAL PRECIPITATION COULD RESULT IN RISES IN RIVER LEVELS THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY, ALTHOUGH RISES ABOVE MINOR FLOOD STAGE ARE NOT ANTICIPATED. THE COMBINATION OF HEAVY RAINS AND STRONGER WIND GUSTS THURSDAY AFTERNOON INTO THURSDAY NIGHT COULD RESULT IN TREE FALL, RESULTING IN THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME POWER OUTAGES. STAY TUNED FOR FURTHER UPDATES AND INFORMATION FROM THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE ON THIS DEVELOPING STORM SYSTEM THROUGH THE DAY.
